class.name: Phaser.Touch

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: A reference to the currently running game.

class.help: Phaser.Touch handles touch events with your game. Note: Android 2.x only supports 1 touch event at once, no multi-touch.

public.name: consumeTouchMove
public.help: Consumes all touchmove events on the document (only enable this if you know you need it!).

public.name: onTouchCancel
public.help: Touch cancel - touches that were disrupted (perhaps by moving into a plugin or browser chrome).\nOccurs for example on iOS when you put down 4 fingers and the app selector UI appears.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

public.name: onTouchEnd
public.help: The handler for the touchend events.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

public.name: onTouchEnter
public.help: For touch enter and leave its a list of the touch points that have entered or left the target.\nDoesn't appear to be supported by most browsers on a canvas element yet.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

public.name: onTouchLeave
public.help: For touch enter and leave its a list of the touch points that have entered or left the target.\nDoesn't appear to be supported by most browsers on a canvas element yet.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

public.name: onTouchMove
public.help: The handler for the touchmove events.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

public.name: onTouchStart
public.help: The internal method that handles the touchstart event from the browser.

parameters.name: event
parameters.help: The native event from the browser. This gets stored in Touch.event.

public.name: callbackContext
public.inlineHelp: The context under which callbacks are called.

public.name: disabled
public.inlineHelp: You can disable all Touch events by setting disabled = true. While set all new touch events will be ignored.

public.name: event
public.inlineHelp: The browser touch DOM event. Will be set to null if no touch event has ever been received.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running game.

public.name: preventDefault
public.inlineHelp: If true the TouchEvent will have prevent.default called on it.

public.name: touchCancelCallback
public.inlineHelp: A callback that can be fired on a touchCancel event.

public.name: touchEndCallback
public.inlineHelp: A callback that can be fired on a touchEnd event.

public.name: touchEnterCallback
public.inlineHelp: A callback that can be fired on a touchEnter event.

public.name: touchLeaveCallback
public.inlineHelp: A callback that can be fired on a touchLeave event.

public.name: touchMoveCallback
public.inlineHelp: A callback that can be fired on a touchMove event.

public.name: touchStartCallback
public.inlineHelp: A callback that can be fired on a touchStart event.
